headline: Hawaiian Cole Slaw
description: Coleslaw mix, pineapple, and onion are mixed in a creamy dressing in this sweet and tangy Hawaiian cole slaw recipe that is great will pulled pork.
name: Hawaiian Cole Slaw

recipeInstructions.text: Mix coleslaw mix, pineapple, and onion together in a bowl.
Whisk mayonnaise, vinegar, brown sugar, cilantro, salt, and pepper together in a bowl until dressing is smooth. Pour dressing over coleslaw mixture and toss to coat. Refrigerate.

review.reviewBody: I tried this for the first time a few days ago and I think it's the best Cole Slaw recipes I have ever tasted. I found it was best the second day.
I made this it's awesome. I didn't have can pineapple so I used fresh. My husband says this is a keeper
We love this recipe! Great with Ribs, fish tacos, and even just plain and add a little protien if you want! Made this already twice in last 10 days! I like the multi color cabbage, carrots etc mix

Followed the recipe as written, just made double. This was a huge hit with all the guys at my husband’s plant. Excellent as the slaw served on top of a pulled pork sandwich. The pineapple balances the cabbage and the vinegary dressing. I am picky about slaw, and I really liked this one too!
This was incredible delicious. We will be making this again & soon!
Delicious!
Wonderfully tangy dressing! Easy to make too.
This recipe is wonderful(mostly). I hate cilantro so I use celery seed instead.
I didn't have apple cider vinegar, so I subbed 3/4 th white vinegar and 1/4 apple juice. I also subbed splenda brown sugar for regular. It was delish!
Delicious! The brown sugar & pineapple ?? gave it an excellent flavor, quick & easy to prepare, everyone Loved it!! I replaced onion with shredded carrot.
Light, sweet, and easy to make. A very nice complement to my vole slaw repertoire.
Not even a big fan of Cole slaw, but this is definitely my favorite version of it. Made it exactly how its says no alterations
This recipe is so delicious! It was easy to make and even my daughter who doesn’t like Cole Slaw she would eat it! Now that’s a winner in my book. Highly recommend.
This recipe is delicious! I used a mix of green and purple cabbage and added a little chopped carrot for color. I didn't have dry cilantro so just used fresh instead. Will definitely make it again.
Outstanding! I added tomatoes and cucumbers

Next time be sure and use the slaw mix, Iused a chopped salad mix. also I would use pineapple chunks instead of crushed and less of the dressing - I used all and it was just too liquidy but the taste was great! I'll get it right next time.....

Delicious 
Dressing is perfect and easy to make
I grate in a little carrot for color and use fresh pineapple as they are abundant here in Hawaii.
Fabulous as a side dish or topping for fish tacos
I made this just as directed, as a side for Kalua Pig, from this site. It was easy to make, very tasty and was the perfect side for the pulled pork.
Made exactly according to recipe. Everyone loved it. Make sure that the onion is diced small and pineapple is drained thoroughly. I might try a little jalapeño on the next batch.
Compliments galore. Very fresh tasting.

Delish.
I was so-so on cole slaw but I had lots of cabbage left over from another dish.
This recipe converted me! Now I'm a slaw slob

"Ooh, that's good!" was the response when sampling this slaw. I used ingredients I had on hand, which means I had everyhing but the onion and cilantro. It came out nice and sweet but not too sweet and tangy with a crisp, smooth texture. I wil make again. Easy, too!
Just finished making, tastes great! Letting it rest and marry now. If it tastes better later, and quite frankly what slaw doesn’t? It will be off the charts!!
Soooo good! Adds a nice tasty sweet twist to my sweet and spicy chili Dorito crunchy flounder tacos!!! Add to anything yummy to step it up!
I used crushed pineapple, which has the consistency of applesauce. No flavor or texture. Also added a bit of garlic powder. Take heed of other comments, all true.

The flavor of this is amazing! My daughter and I do not like slaw but the rest of my family does so I decided to give this a try. She and I both ended up loving it! We didn’t want too much pineapple or dressing so used a 14 ounce bag of slaw mix and we used pineapples in heavy syrup. (I appreciate the suggestions from other reviews!) She suggested using curry and cumin in place of the oregano and it worked well. Next time we will use oregano because I have to try this again!
It's a keeper! Made this with pulled pork sliders and the family loved it!
I will definitely make this again. I used half crushed pineapple and half tidbits. I made it for a Hawaiian potluck and it was a hit!! Even the man whose wife was raised in Hawaii loved it.
Forgot the onion and put a handful of fresh cilantro
This was an easy recipe. I would make this again. I used whole canned pineapple only two and chopped up.

I didn't have pineapples so I left them out, but did everything else is exact. it was pretty tasty. I served it with pulled pork sandwiches and it was amazing!! I will definitely be using this recipe again and will try it with the pineapples too.
A little too much liquid
This slaw was fabulous. Great on BBQ pork sandwiches. A new family favorite.
Made this for 200 people. Just added a bit of the pineapple juice

Made this with two heads of cabbage. One white and one red. Didn't have the pineapple chunks, but successfully added craisins. This was so delicious. The family loved it. Gave some to new friends and they were also delighted. Great recipe.

I made this recipe for a Luau party I was having. We served it to go with Kalua Pork sliders on sweet rolls. It was quite tasty. Just make sure to not have too much dressing on it or it gets soggy. I also put a little less pineapple in it than it called for.
This was delicious! I followed the recipe completely. Only dropping off onions because I cannot stand raw onions! Other than that delete this is super good. Can't wait to share at the picnic!
I made it and it was as advertised. Great. My wife said it wasn't sweet enough, I thought it was just right. I will definitely make it again... as published.

I didn't like it. It wasn't sweet enough for me. Perhaps if I would have bought the pineapple in heavy syrup it would have been better. I also thought there was too much onion. I made the recipe exactly as written. It has lots of great reviews, I just didn't care for it.
Wonderful coleslaw! All I did different was use the 10 oz bag of coleslaw mix, the higher ratio worked out perfect with the sauce.
I love the tart sweet flavor and its so easy to make.

This was really tasty. I like the pineapple in it a lot. The only change I will do next time is add less liquid. It was a little soggy for the hubbys taste??
Thank you??
We did not like it very much.

I followed the dressing exactly, but we're snowed in so the fresh veggies were subbed with what's on hand. Shredded cabbage, pineapple tidbits cut in half, red onions and a little green pepper was called into play. I've never had pineapple in cole slaw before, but it's wonderful. Thank you so much for sharing the love.

This is probably the only recipe from the site that I made exactly as listed. I actually had all the ingredients! It was super easy and really good. I think I will use this when I need a potluck dish.

This is probably the only recipe from the site that I made exactly as listed. I actually had all the ingredients! It was super easy and really good. I think I will use this when I need a potluck dish.

Light and refreshing. Easy to make. I used fresh pineapple instead of canned and simply eliminated the cilantro as I did not have it on hand. I think it may have added another dimension to the recipe, though. I also found that we need to add an extra 2 heaping tablespoons to the mix as the 1/2 cup did not seem to coat the coleslaw enough. I would make again this time with the cilantro.

Everyone loved it! I made it for my husband’s birthday and even people who don’t usually dive into salads had seconds and thirds. Ive made it again and tried a different kind of vinegar and sugar, still pretty good. Is my to go recipe for pot luck get togethers!
enjoyed the pineapple paired with the sweet sour dressing. made it, as suggested, with BBQ ribs, yum!
No i did not. It was awesome.
I made a big batch for a party, using twice as much slaw, and added chopped macadamia nuts (roasted, salted). Delicious!

I would rate 3.5 stars. The ratios seem a bit skewed. Used the 1 pound bag of chopped cabbage. Seemed like a high pineapple to cabbage ratio. The dressing part easily covered the cabbage mixture despite using the 1 pound bag of chopped cabbage. Followed the rest of the recipe. I think the flavors would really pop if you used fresh cilantro instead of dried. But all in all, it is a good recipe that worked really well with baby back ribs and a Riesling.

I doubled the dressing and added lemon juice. I used red onion. I also used fresh cilantro instead of dried. I will definitely be making this for bbq parties this summer. It adds something light and refreshing to all the heavy meats at a bbq.
PS...I never liked cole slaw until now.
2 of us liked it. I didn't. It was too tangy and too oniony. The pineapple wasn't very noticeable. I won't be making this again.
This was delicious! I used vegan mayo and frozen pineapple, but otherwise followed the recipe. It is a great Cole slaw but would also be amazing on fish tacos!
This was way too tart for me. I even used extra slaw mix and it still didn’t help. I would cut the vinegar down to 1 T.
The best Cole slaw I’ve ever had! Made it with/for on top of Kalua pork sandwiches. Thanks for the recipe.
Made it but they only had a 14 oz bag of slaw mix. So I added small can of can milk to make more juice. My Mom always put can milk and sugar in her slaw so it was great!

I doubled this recipe for our Super Bowl party we’re having.. smoking Ribs .. my bbq bakes beans.. I thought this coleslaw would go perfect with the Ribs..The only change I made.. I added a little less of the apple cider vinegar.. and added a1/4 cup of the drained pineapple juice that I saved.. WHOA! ... definitely making this again!!!!
Made it without any changes, and this was the best cole slaw I’ve ever made!
My kids ask for this. And I sneak bites off their plates.
The best!!!
This tasted excellent along side of my pulled pork sandwiches. Highly recommend. I'll be making it again.
This coleslaw is great went over very well with pulled pork
A very good coleslaw! Easy, quick. Crunch plus a bit of sweetness in every bite. Great for home or potlucks.

I added some modifications
1 tsp finely chopped dill and Chives
used fresh cilantro
thinly sliced sweet onion
used cane sugar instead of brown
1/2 avacado blended with the mayo 
used the inside of celery with the leaves.

It turned out really good.. Great combination.
This was a hit with my guests. I doubled the recipe and it turned out perfectly. No changes to it.

I served this with the slow cooker Kalua pork from this site. I've made it twice already, nice complement. It's important to drain the pineapple well, or it will be too "wet". Next time I will use an 8 oz can of tidbits, rather than crushed.

I've made this a few times now, both with and without the pineapple, and each time it was excellent. I used a 16-oz bag of coleslaw mix because after it sits for a few hours it can get a little soupy when you only use 8-oz. I also omitted the onion (I don't like raw onion) and it still came out great. My favorite way to serve it is piled on top of a pulled pork taco. Delicious and easy! This is definitely a recipe I'll keep around.
Delicious
Easy to make and I actually used it on spicy shredded chicken tacos to add sweetness, offsetting the heat! My family loved it!
The whole family loved this! I think. Next time I will use less onion as it became overpowering and use more pineapple. Great recipe!
I used a 16 oz package of slaw and found the recipe to be balanced a bit better for my taste. Great flavor and I would make it again.
I used a 16 oz package of slaw and found the recipe to be balanced a bit better for my taste. Great flavor and I would make it again.

An interesting slaw recipe indeed! It is tangy and acidic while having a backnote of pineapple sweetness. I admittedly only used half the pineapple and thought that was an appropriate amount. My only issue was that I poured the liquid onto the slaw without realizing it was too much. So be careful to not use all the sauce unless you like it soupy.

My family loved this! I wasn't sure about the pineapple but it was great, makes this a unique and delicious cole slaw. It will be the only recipe I use from now on. I didn't add the cilantro as I didn't have any on hand but I don't think it's really needed.
My husband told me that he liked Cole Slaw that had pineapple in it, but I had never heard of using pineapple. Well I was very excited to make it for him after finding this recipe. We both loved it!
Ridiculously simple and awesome. My wife hates cole slaw and she even liked it. I made a double batch and they ate it all!
I omitted the onion and added just a little shredded ginger.. yum..
It was perfect.

the pineapple and stopped when I got to half because it looked right. I also added only half the dressing. It was really delicious! I put it on top of my Kalua Pig in a Slow Cooker pork sandwich. Definitely a delicious coleslaw!
Loved it! I was looking for something different and this was the perfect recipe. Never ever thought about putting pineapple in coleslaw but it really worked. Thank you so much for this unique dish!
Not bad! A little vinegary for me but still pretty darn good with BBQ.
I used a red onion and parsley instead of the cilantro.
This recipe was good...just too much onion for our taste. The pineapple gave it a nice flavor.

This was a very simple and tasty slaw. The only changes I made: I used a 10oz package of coleslaw mix and parsley instead of cilantro (didn't have any and don't care for it). My can of crushed pineapple was 20oz so I did not use all of it, next time I definitely will. I may even switch to tidbits instead of crushed. The pineapple flavor was very subtle. But, very simple ingredients and a great side dish with our pulled pork and homemade mac and cheese ( used Chef John's recipe on this site). I disagree with other reviews that they did not think it was enough marinade/sauce. I thought it was plenty and may even do a touch less next time. I prefer more cabbage than sauce with my coleslaw.
Was very good.

I added a 1/4 tsp of mustard,used red onion, omitted cilantro, since I didn't have dried, and used a 16 oz. bag of slaw .
Wonderful, and plenty of dressing for my need.
Wanted a slaw that would go well with seared Ahi. A perfect match.

I had to use a 10 once bag because that's the only bag the stores carry. Nothing else was changed, and I will definitely make this again for my work snack day. Brought to a graduation party and someone brought rice with burnt green peppers and I use the slaw dressing to cover up the nasty taste.

I used a 14-oz bag of coleslaw--I have never seen an 8.5-oz bag in the stores here in the Twin Cities. I can't recall now (I made it a few days ago) if I then doubled all the other ingredients (since the amount of coleslaw was nearly double). I didn't have cilantro so used dried parsley. Taste was pretty good. I would likely make this again.
I used fresh pineapple and half green onion, half red onion, to use what I had on hand. I followed the recipe otherwise. Delicious!

Yummy! :) I love the idea of adding pineapple to boring ol' coleslaw. It is tangy and sweet and fruity! I am going to make some steaks on the grill, and a baked potato, and BAM dinner is served. Thanks for a great accompaniment. I will try this recipe on my inlaws when they come over. :)

Love Love Loved it! My supermarket does not carry 150z cans of pineapple so I purchased the 20oz and just added more cole slaw mix and served it with pulled pork sandwiches, absolutely delicious. Will certainly be making again. Thanks for recipe!!
This was deeeelish. I love the addition of pineapple. I made this for bbq pork sandwiches. God willing...I will make this over and over again...nummies.
Husband really likes it, and that's what counts
Good enough to serve to guests. I thought the marinade was not quite enough. Perhaps doubling the dressing would be a good idea.
Shredded my own cabbage and added shredded carrots, rather than using the the cole slaw mix, as that is what I had on hand. Very good! Will definitely make this again!
Excellent coleslaw! Just the right amount of tangy and savory. I didn't have apple cider vinegar so I just used regular white vinegar--still excellent!
